auto_merge.commit_title: fix(channel): handle writing to file instead of pipe (#30519)

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.body: should this go just after the if condition (line 80)?

I was trying to match the order in the `write_cb()` below, where `write_cb` is checked after calling `wstream_release_buffer()`, and `closed` is checked afterwards. When `write_cb` is `NULL`, `closed` won't be set here, so `wstream_release_wbuffer()` is the only one needed here. An alternative is to move that part of `write_cb()` into a separate function, but then the `pending_reqs--` needs to be paired with a `pending_reqs++`, which I'm not sure where to put in this branch.

i'm trying to understand, do we indicate anywhere that the lack of `stream.uvstream` implies a `stream.fd` ?  Should this be documented on `struct stream` , or a brief comment here? Normally this decided by a discriminator field...

In other places, the lack of `stream.uvstream` is taken to imply the presence of `stream.uv.idle`. 

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/f3b7444e6638095305d86fa96fe0b7407c9b1648/src/nvim/event/rstream.c#L47-L51
If you look at `fread_idle_cb`, you'll see that it reads from `stream->s.fd`. Maybe an `assert(uvstream == NULL ? fd >= 0 : fd < 0)` is needed `stream_init()`.

good point, but this is all very subtle, no? A brief docstring would really help (and an assert couldn't hurt). 

I see your latest push, thanks!

```suggestion
      -- Simulate shell redirection: "nvim ... > Xstdio_redir". #30509
      stdio = { nil, fd, nil },
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -288,6 +288,36 @@ describe('channels', function()
     eq({ 'notification', 'exit', { 3, 0 } }, next_msg())
   end)
 
+  it('stdio channel works with stdout redirected to file', function()
+    t.write_file(
+      'Xstdio_write.vim',
+      [[
+        let chan = stdioopen({})
+        call chansend(chan, 'foo')
+        call chansend(chan, 'bar')
+        qall!
+      ]]
+    )
+    local fd = assert(vim.uv.fs_open('Xstdio_redir', 'w', 420))
+    local exit_code, exit_signal
+    local handle = vim.uv.spawn(nvim_prog, {
+      args = { '-u', 'NONE', '-i', 'NONE', '--headless', '-S', 'Xstdio_write.vim' },
+      stdio = { nil, fd, nil },

title: fix(channel): handle writing to file instead of pipe
